title: Beastly Appendage
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

| [![Beastly appendage.png](/images/3/31/Beastly_appendage.png)](/File:Beastly_appendage.png) Beastly Appendage |                                                         |
| :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Level                                                                                                         | 1                                                       |
| School1                                                                                                       | [Transmutation](/Transmutations "Transmutations")       |
| Source(s)                                                                                                     | - [Book of Changes](/Book_of_Changes "Book of Changes") |
| [Casting noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                                                                   | 1                                                       |
| [Spell noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                                                                     | 0                                                       |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| - | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Causes monstrous horns and talons to grow from the caster's body, granting them a chance of making an extra attack in melee. It is not powerful enough to enhance appendages that are already nonhuman.For [Octopodes](/Octopode "Octopode"):Causes a vicious spike to grow from one of the caster's tentacles, increasing the damage of their extra tentacle attacks. It is not powerful enough to affect tentacles which are already mutated. |

**Beastly Appendage** is a level 1 [Transmutations](/Transmutations "Transmutations") spell.

[Transmuters](/Transmuter "Transmuter") begin with this spell memorized.

## Effect

Beastly Appendage briefly gives you the following temporary combat enhancing [mutations](/Mutation "Mutation"), melding armour in the process:

- [Horns 2](/Horns "Horns") - grants an auxiliary headbutt attack, melding [helmets](/Helmet "Helmet").
- [Talons 2](/Talons "Talons") - grants an auxiliary kick attack, melding [boots](/Boots "Boots").
  - Like other Transmutations, Beastly Appendage will fully meld [Lear's hauberk](/Lear%27s_hauberk "Lear's hauberk").

The duration of these mutations is dependent upon your [spell power](/Spell_power "Spell power"). Casting the spell again extends the duration of your current mutations.

### Restrictions

Your helmet and boot slot (or equivalent) will meld, even if these mutations aren't valid:

- [Armataurs](/Armataur "Armataur"), [nagas](/Naga "Naga"), [merfolk](/Merfolk "Merfolk"), and [felids](/Felid "Felid") cannot get Talons, as they don't have humanoid feet. However, their [boots](/Boots "Boots") / [bardings](/Barding "Barding") are melded, anyway.
- Octopodes, being incompatible with either mutation, gain a [spiked tentacle 3](/Good_mutations#Tentacle_Spike "Good mutations") instead. Their hat slot is still melded.

[Undead](/Undead "Undead") species ([ghouls](/Ghoul "Ghoul"), [mummies](/Mummies "Mummies"), bloodless [vampires](/Vampire "Vampire")) can't cast this spell, like other [form](/Transformation "Transformation")-changing spells.

## Strategy

Beastly Appendage can significantly improve the combat capabilities of low level melee characters. It isn't likely for an early adventurer to have helmets or boots, so melding these aux armour slots shouldn't be noticeable.

Beastly Appendage doesn't give any special bonus to [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat"). Low level Transmuters can feel free to wield and train with a weapon. Note that further Transmutations ([Spider Form](/Spider_Form "Spider Form") & [Ice Form](/Ice_Form "Ice Form")) do rely on Unarmed, though.

## History

- This spell was removed in [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), along with the Transmutations spell school.
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), the spell could provide either Horns 2 or Talons 3 (instead of both) and couldn't meld aux armour in those slots.
- Prior to [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), Claws 3 was a possible result.
- Prior to [0.11](/0.11 "0.11"), Beastly Appendage gave you Tentacles for arms instead of Claws.
- Beastly Appendage was added in [0.10](/0.10 "0.10").

html:
Beastly Appendage

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
 Beastly Appendage
Level 1
School1 Transmutation
Source(s)
  • Book of Changes
Casting noise 1
Spell noise 0

Causes monstrous horns and talons to grow from the caster's body, granting them a chance of making an extra attack in melee. It is not powerful enough to enhance appendages that are already nonhuman.

For Octopodes:

Causes a vicious spike to grow from one of the caster's tentacles, increasing the damage of their extra tentacle attacks. It is not powerful enough to affect tentacles which are already mutated.

Beastly Appendage is a level 1 Transmutations spell.

Transmuters begin with this spell memorized.

Effect

Beastly Appendage briefly gives you the following temporary combat enhancing mutations, melding armour in the process:

  • Horns 2 - grants an auxiliary headbutt attack, melding helmets.
  • Talons 2 - grants an auxiliary kick attack, melding boots.
    • Like other Transmutations, Beastly Appendage will fully meld Lear's hauberk.

The duration of these mutations is dependent upon your spell power. Casting the spell again extends the duration of your current mutations.

Restrictions

Your helmet and boot slot (or equivalent) will meld, even if these mutations aren't valid:

  • Armataurs, nagas, merfolk, and felids cannot get Talons, as they don't have humanoid feet. However, their boots / bardings are melded, anyway.
  • Octopodes, being incompatible with either mutation, gain a spiked tentacle 3 instead. Their hat slot is still melded.

Undead species (ghouls, mummies, bloodless vampires) can't cast this spell, like other form-changing spells.

Strategy

Beastly Appendage can significantly improve the combat capabilities of low level melee characters. It isn't likely for an early adventurer to have helmets or boots, so melding these aux armour slots shouldn't be noticeable.

Beastly Appendage doesn't give any special bonus to Unarmed Combat. Low level Transmuters can feel free to wield and train with a weapon. Note that further Transmutations (Spider Form & Ice Form) do rely on Unarmed, though.

History

  • This spell was removed in 0.31, along with the Transmutations spell school.
  • Prior to 0.26, the spell could provide either Horns 2 or Talons 3 (instead of both) and couldn't meld aux armour in those slots.
  • Prior to 0.12, Claws 3 was a possible result.
  • Prior to 0.11, Beastly Appendage gave you Tentacles for arms instead of Claws.
  • Beastly Appendage was added in 0.10.
Transformations
Talisman Beast Form • Flux Form • Blade Form • Maw Form • Serpent Form • Dragon Form • Statue Form • Death Form • Storm Form
Bad Forms Bat Form • Fungus Form • Pig Form • Tree Form • Wisp Form
Divine Shadow Form
